artist: Unknown Italian, 17th century; Formerly attributed to Ventura Salimbeni
inscription:
Inscription and Stamp

bottom center on mount, in brown ink: [Salimbene]; bottom center on mount, in pencil in modern hand: [B. 1557 D. 1613]; on back of mount, in purple pencil: [315]; on back of mount, in pencil: [6-140-10] and [9]; on back, in black ink: [W176]
medium: Black and white chalk on red prepared paper
provenance: ?Ephraim Collection, Lugano, as by Poccetti. Sale, Sotheby's, London, June 26, 1969, no. 16, as Poccetti. Jean C. Genty, Lugt 3424, Lugano (his sale, Christie's, London, July 16, 1978, no. 3?, to Scarpa); [Pietro Scarpa, Venice, 1978, sold for $1, 250 to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1978-d. 2010; bequeathed to Mia).
title: Two Studies of a Seated Male Figure
